String
typedef struct
String

The struct that represents a String.  This class is for storing and manipulating Strings.  General usage is as follows:

String *list=String_t.new();
String_t.<func to call>(list, <params>);
...
String_t.delete(&list);
See Also

String_t

Variables
genericList
GenericList genericList

The underlying storage and memory management for the string.

str
char *str
length
int length

The length of the string excluding the NULL terminator.

String_t
extern const struct
String_t

The struct that creates and performs operations on objects of type String.

See Also

String

Functions
setSize
bool (
*setSize
)(String *self, const int len)

Allocates enough space for a string of length len+1. (for NULL terminator) Contents of the string will not be changed unless the new size is less than the current size.  No terminating NULL character is added, this is purely just to set the size of the underlying array.  If len==0 then String_t.clear will be called.

Memory contents are not initialized.

Useful for reducing reallocations when you know the final size of the string.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

len

The number of characters to allocate space for (excluding the terminating null).

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

set
bool (
*set
)(String *self, const char * const newStr)

Copies the contents of a NULL terminated string.

If newStr is empty or NULL then String_t.clear will be called.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

newStr

A NULL terminated string to copy.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

setNonNullString
bool (
*setNonNullString
)(String *self, const char * const newStr, const int strLen)

Copies the contents of a non-NULL terminated string.

If newStr is empty or NULL then String_t.clear will be called.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

newStr

The string to copy.

strLen

The length of the string being copied.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

concat
bool (
*concat
)(String *self, const char * const newStr)

Appends a NULL terminated string to the current string.

Only one reallocation is performed.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

newStr

A NULL terminated string to append to the current string.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

concatChar
bool (
*concatChar
)(String *self, const char newChar)

Appends a character to the current string.

If the string is currently empty, the NULL terminating character is added.

Only one reallocation is performed.

Parameters
self

The string to perform the operation on.

newChar

The character to append.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

copyOtherBetween
bool (
*copyOtherBetween
)(String *self, const String * const other, const int startIndex, const int endIndex)

Copies another string given the supplied indexes.

If startIndex is less than 0, endIndex is greater than the length of the string being copied, or startIndex>endIndex, no operation occurs.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

other

The string object to copy from.

startIndex

The starting index to copy from in other (inclusive).

endIndex

The last index to copy from in other (exclusive).

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

toUpper
void (
*toUpper
)(String *self)

Makes a string uppercase.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

Returns

Nothing

toLower
void (
*toLower
)(String *self)

Makes a string lowercase.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

Returns

Nothing

contains
int (
*contains
)(const String *self, const char * const token)

Returns the index of where the substring starts in the current string, or -1 if not present.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operaion on.

token

The substring to look for in the string.

Returns

True or fa

getFirstIndexOf
int (
*getFirstIndexOf
)(const String * const self, const char searchChar)

Finds the first instance of the given char in the string.

Searching stops when the first char is found.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

searchChar

The character to search for in the string.

Returns

The index of the first instance of searchChar in the string, or -1 if it was not found.

getLastIndexOf
int (
*getLastIndexOf
)(const String * const self, const char searchChar)

Finds the last instance of the given char in the string.

Searching stops when the last char is found.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

searchChar

The character to search for in the string.

Returns

The index of the last instance of searchChar in the string, or -1 is it was not found.

getCharOccurrences
int (
*getCharOccurrences
)(const String *self, const char *searchChars)

Counts the number of occurrences of the characters in searchChars in the current string.

Duplicate characters in searchChars are ignored, only the first instance of a char will be used when searching.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

searchChars

The characters to search for in the string.

Returns

The number of characters in the string that are found in searchChars.

trimWhitespace
bool (
*trimWhitespace
)(String *self)

Removes whitespace characters (' ','\t') from the beginning and end of the string.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object, unless strictAlloc is true for the underlying GenericList data structure (defaults to false).

removeChars
bool (
*removeChars
)(String *self, const char * const unwantedChars)

Removes the supplied chars from the string.  If all of the characters are removed from the string then the string is cleared.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

unwantedChars

A NULL terminated string containing the chars to remove.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object, unless strictAlloc is true for the underlying GenericList data structure (defaults to false).

See Also

  • GenericList.strictAlloc

clear
bool (
*clear
)(String *self)

Clears the contents of the string, sets length to 0.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

Returns

Returns true if the operation was successful and changes were made to the object.  A return value of false guarantees no changes were made to the object.

equalsCharArray
bool (
*equalsCharArray
)(const String * const self, const char * const other)

Returns true/false depending if the strings are equal or not.  Two NULL strings are considered equal. Two empty strings are considered equal.

Parameters
self

The string object to perform the operation on.

other

The string to compare to.

Returns

True if the strings are equal, false if they aren't.
